title: Conflict as a Resource
content: Conflict isn't inherently bad. Task conflict—disagreement about how to do work—often improves outcomes by surfacing different perspectives and preventing premature consensus. Relationship conflict—personal animosity—damages teams. The skill is enabling productive task conflict while preventing relationship conflict.

mcq.question: Two team members disagree strongly about the best approach to a problem. Is this good or bad?

options.B: Good—diverse views improve decisions if managed well

mcq.explanation: Task disagreement surfaces assumptions and alternatives. The goal isn't eliminating conflict but managing it productively. 'What's your reasoning?' not 'You're wrong.' Harmony without debate often means unchallenged errors.

openQuestions: How does your team handle disagreements about approach?
When has conflict improved your team's outcomes?
